archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang-Glazed Duck Breast with Mango-Habanero Salsa, Sesame Cabbage Slaw, and Brown & Wild Rice
description: Crisp-skinned duck breasts glazed with a hot gochujang-honey soy marinade, served with bright mango-habanero salsa, a tangy sesame cabbage slaw, and hearty brown & wild rice. Built hot and from scratch with Korean and Latin American elements.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown and wild rice under cold water; drain.
Score duck breast skin in a crosshatch (do not cut into meat). Pat dry.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, lime juice, olive oil, black pepper, and a pinch of salt to make marinade.
Toss duck in marinade; set aside 10–15 minutes (reserve 2 tablespoons marinade separately for glazing).
For salsa: dice mango, finely dice red onion, and mince habanero peppers (remove seeds for slightly less heat). Chop coriander.
Mix mango, red onion, habanero peppers, coriander, lime juice, and a pinch of salt; set aside.
For slaw: thinly slice cabbage. In a bowl, mix rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, chilli flakes, and a pinch of salt. Add cabbage and toss. Sprinkle sesame seeds.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high, oiling grates lightly.
cook_steps: Combine rinsed brown and wild rice with 3 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer until tender (30–40 minutes). Keep warm.
Place duck breasts skin-side down on the preheated grill over indirect-to-medium heat. Cook 6–8 minutes to render fat and crisp skin (manage flare-ups).
Flip duck breasts and grill 3–5 minutes more to medium-rare/medium (target 54–60°C/130–140°F internal).
Brush duck with the reserved marinade during the last minute; grill 30–60 seconds to set the glaze.
Transfer duck to a board and rest 5 minutes, then slice across the grain.
Fluff rice with a fork and season to taste with salt.
Plate rice, add sliced duck, spoon mango-habanero salsa over the duck, and serve sesame cabbage slaw on the side.
